data.title: Minimap: Show Full Document

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: Love that minimap has been added to VC Code!  I'd like to request an option for it to work similar to Visual Studio where it takes up the entire vertical spaces always and does not scroll.  I like being able to see/select my absolute position in the document (even if the code is very compressed), as opposed to just having a zoomed out view of the code that doesn't encompass the entire document.

data.title: Git log viewer like in Jetbrains IDEs
data.body:
We need a smart log viewer for Git like in Jetbrains IDEs such as Webstorm / PHPStorm:
https://d3nmt5vlzunoa1.cloudfront.net/phpstorm/files/2013/11/phpstorm_7_1_log_viewer.png 

(There are many Git log related extensions for VSC, but none of them are user friendly and feature rich like in Jetbrains IDEs)

data.title: Auto saving doesn't work when starting debugging
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open some code that uses the debugging feature
2. Run, now it saves before starting it (but only the current file being edited, another bug)
3. Edit some code and press 'Restart' (Ctrl-Shift-F5)
4. It will then instantly restart it without saving any of the code (which it did in 1.9)

data.title: JSDoc autogeneration not working?
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: OSX Sierra

Behaviour of my VSCode doesn't match [release notes](https://code.visualstudio.com/updates/v1_10#_auto-jsdoc-comments)

No `@param`s are added to the generated block.

![autodoc](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/822105/23534099/b079d98c-0009-11e7-8322-c8383f5dd4c9.gif)

data.title: BUG: When search is open & you're editing files, vscode lags dramatically
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: Version 1.9.0 (1.9.0)
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Go into your project & search for something that occurs regularly - E.g the name of a react component
2. Wait for the results to appear in the left sidebar
3. Click on a file that contains the SEARCH term
4. Start editing that file
5. Notice the lag

Confirmed that this happens when searching for a term that occurs 3 times - The code editor will lag

Probably due to vscode dynamically updating the search in the sidebar every time a change is made? I do notice that the sidebar will dynamically change the snippet of code if it as been changed

data.title: Feature Request: Support for private marketplace/gallery
data.body:
We have created several VSIX extension that have no use to anybody else except our company. We would like to host our own private extension gallery and have an ability to specify alternative extension gallery paths (like "Additional Extension Galleries" in Visual Studio 2015).

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

data.title: Multi-target debugging fails to execute second configuration saying it doesn't exist when exact copy of name of configuration

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Anniversary Edition

Steps to Reproduce:

1. I have a asp.net spa angular 2 application that I'm trying to debug both .net core and into chrome, firefox or Edge automatically on F5.
2. I have the following launch.json:
```
{
    "version": "0.2.0",
    "compounds": [
        {
            "name": "Debug in Chrome",
            "configurations": [
                ".NET Core Launch (console)",
                "Launch Chrome"
            ]
        },
        {
            "name": "Debug in Edge",
            "configurations": [
                ".NET Core Launch (console)",
                "Launch Edge"
            ]
        },
                {
            "name": "Debug in Firefox",
            "configurations": [
                ".NET Core Launch (console)",
                "Launch Firefox"
            ]
        }
    ],    
    "configurations": [        
         {
            "name": "Launch Edge",
            "type": "edge",
            "request": "launch",
            "url": "http://localhost:5000",
            "webRoot": "${workspaceRoot}/app/files",
            "sourceMaps": true
        },
        {
            "type": "firefox",
            "request": "launch",
            "name": "Launch Firefox",
            "url": "http://localhost:5000",
            "webRoot": "${workspaceRoot}"
        },
        {
            "type": "chrome",
            "request": "launch",
            "name": "Launch Chrome",
            "url": "http://localhost:5000",
            "webRoot": "${workspaceRoot}/wwwroot",
            "userDataDir": "${workspaceRoot}/.vscode/chrome"
        },
        {
            "name": ".NET Core Launch (console)",
            "type": "coreclr",
            "request": "launch",
            "preLaunchTask": "build",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}/bin/Debug/netcoreapp1.1/<dllname>.dll",
            "args": [],
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
            "stopAtEntry": false,
            "externalConsole": false,
            "env": {
                "ASPNETCORE_ENVIRONMENT": "Development"
            },
            "sourceFileMap": {
                "/Views": "${workspaceRoot}/Views"
            }
        },
        {
            "name": ".NET Core Launch (web)",
            "type": "coreclr",
            "request": "launch",
            "preLaunchTask": "build",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}/bin/Debug/netcoreapp1.1/<dllname>.dll",
            "args": [],
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
            "stopAtEntry": false,
            "launchBrowser": {
                "enabled": true,
                "args": "${auto-detect-url}",
                "windows": {
                    "command": "cmd.exe",
                    "args": "/C start ${auto-detect-url}"
                },
                "osx": {
                    "command": "open"
                },
                "linux": {
                    "command": "xdg-open"
                }
            },
            "env": {
                "ASPNETCORE_ENVIRONMENT": "Development"
            },
            "sourceFileMap": {
                "/Views": "${workspaceRoot}/Views"
            }
        },
        {
            "name": ".NET Core Attach",
            "type": "coreclr",
            "request": "attach",
            "processId": "${command.pickProcess}"
        }
    ]
}
```

3. If I use  .NET Core Launch (console) or Launch Chrome they work fine by themselves.
4. If I use the Debug in Chrome (or Edge or Firefox) VS Code gives me an error saying that the configuration "Launch Chrome" doesn't exist in my launch.json which it clearly does.
5. If I move the compounds to the bottom of the file it doesn't matter. No matter what it gives the same error.
6. If I change the order of the configurations so that the Launch Chrome configuration is first this works and both launch but if you interact with the browser at all it crashes.
7. Also note that the browser starts before the .NET Core Launch (console) is finished starting. It's important that this waits otherwise you end up having to refresh the browser after it finishes building and running the .net core solution even if this was to work. (it would be better if the .NET core Launch (web) instead of launching browser could launch another configuration so that it was clear when it was done and then ran the second one automatically (i.e. all of the configurations should allow that once done to run additional configurations in a nested style (recursively)

data.title: Feature request: Add option for current opened file's directory to 'terminal.integrated.cwd'
data.body:
Currently when opening the integrated terminal, we have two options for the default terminal path:
1. The path is set to the current working directory (i.e. the current working project folder).
2. The path is set to an explicit path given by the user.

There should be a 3rd option, where the path is the current opened file's directory.

data.title: additionalTextEdits runs before selection is added to document
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: Windows 7 64 SP1 

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a completion item like this:
```typescript
    const completionItem = new CompletionItem("test", CompletionItemKind.Property);
    completionItem.additionalTextEdits = [TextEdit.insert(position, " = ")]
    return completionItem;
```
2. I was expecting to see ` = `  inserted after the `test` keyword was added, but actually the text inserted from the `CompletionItem` replaces the `additionalTextEdits` actions. If I CTRL+Z I can see the selected completion item replaced it.

3. In my case, I want to run the `additionalTextEdits` after the keyword selected in the autocomplete is added to the document, so it would be good if we had `additionalTextEditsBeforeSelectionAdded` and `additionalTextEditsAfterSelectionAdded`

data.title: startSession not called when debug session started with vscode.startDebug
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.3

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Register a `startSession` command in an extension.
2. Register another command that calls `vscode.startDebug`.
3. Launch extension
4. Start debug session by selecting launch profile in Debug viewlet and clicking launch icon. - startSession` is called.
5. Stop session.
6. Invoke command from 2. - Session starts without invoking `startSession`.

data.title: Tree in broken state after File Copy/Paste
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1, commit 653f8733dd5
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

I apologize in advance that I wasn't able to come up with a smaller repro.

After copy/pasting a file in a deeply nested directory within the open workspace, the directory the file was pasted into appears to be the top-level directory of the workspace... kind of. The higher level directories appear below the pasted directory, and the pasted directory appears in the "normal" part of the file tree. Moreover, the pasted directory appears to be open in the "normal" part of the tree, but it's contents are not located below the pasted directory's name. Hopefully the clip below will provide some clarification.

![file_copy_messes_up_file_tree](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3226984/23527325/58b4b5ce-ff4a-11e6-9740-7554fd61f25b.gif)

Steps to Reproduce:

1.
```
git clone https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript
cd TypeScript
code .
```
2. Right click to copy some file under `tests/cases/fourslash`. For sake of consistency, use `tests/cases/fourslash/breakpointValidationDo.ts`
3. Right click paste the file under the directory `tests/cases/fourslash`. Note that `tests/cases/fourslash` must be expanded for the bug to occur.
4. Observe that the file navigation tree is in a weird state.

data.title: Auto JSDoc comments should also add other tags @returns, @throws, etc.
data.body: It would be good if [Auto JSDoc comments](https://code.visualstudio.com/updates/v1_10#_auto-jsdoc-comments) automatically added also other annotations than `@param`. It should at least add `@return` (or `@returns`) and `@throws`. It would be great if those were also configurable (e.g. prefer `@return` or `@returns`; do not add `@return` if function returns only `undefined`; and so on).

data.title: Cannot navigate completions when signature help is active

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Use a language that provides signature help as well as code completion (for example typescript)
2. Type a function name and the opening parenthesis 
3. Notice the signature help open

4a. Type a letter to start completion
5a. Try to navigate the completion list using the up or down arrow
6a. Notice how the cursor moves instead of the selected completion item

4b. Press ctrl+space to start completion
5b. Try to navigate the completion list using the up or down arrow
6b. Notice how the cursor moves instead of the selected completion item

4c. Press escape to close the signature help
5c. Type a letter to start completion
6c. Try to navigate the completion list using the up or down arrow
7c. The selected item in the completion list now changes, the cursor stays still

I would expect to always be able to navigate the completion list using the arrow keys, or
to always be able to move the cursor (and then be able to navigate the completion list
with something like ctrl+arrow keys). The current non-consistent behavior makes it common
to erroneously move the cursor (and close the completions) when you meant to select an
item in the completion list.

I made a little video to try to demonstrate the problem but it might be hard to follow
without knowing the keypresses so please try the three branches in the above steps 
if you don't see what I mean.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=386OJAtxX0o

data.title: Website text easily gets jagged on download page
data.body:
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.10
- Browser: Firefox 51.0.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open http://code.visualstudio.com/docs/?dv=linux64_deb
2. Hover over a link or scroll hastily
3. Now text look like this 
![screenshot from 2017-03-02 21-04-43](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/817422/23525213/f59dab00-ff8d-11e6-90cb-61d0e6760329.png)

This only happens on the download page and it only seem to happen when the loading animation for the top extensions are running (which by the way seems way to long?).
I realize that this probably is due to a bug in Firefox, the Intel graphic drivers or somethings else but I have never seen it on any other page so I wanted to start by reporting it here. I don't know, maybe you are doing something strange on that page.
I tried changing the font of the page to a standard system font but the behavior did not change.

data.title: Feature request: Set document language with parameter for changeLanguageMode command
data.body:
It would be useful if you could optionally pass a parameter to the `workbench.action.editor.changeLanguageMode` command to directly set the desired language instead of opening the language list.

See also the following questions regarding this issue:

- http://stackoverflow.com/questions/40200788/how-to-change-language-mode-of-vscode-programmatically
- http://stackoverflow.com/questions/41639887/how-can-i-create-a-custom-keybinding-to-change-syntax-highlighting-to-a-specific
- https://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/vstudio/en-US/25fd8d95-9de3-4465-8c64-82d68dcd2e47/shortcut-how-to-switch-between-typescript-and-html-with-one-or-two-shortcuts

And this comment: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/8729#issuecomment-277838057

Ideally you would also be able to set a specific language with a keyboard shortcut, though I'm not sure if passing command parameters is possible in `keybindings.json`. If not that would be another issue I guess.

data.title: "Select to copy" in integrated terminal

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
[iTerm2](https://www.iterm2.com/documentation-general-usage.html) has a very convenient feature which copies any selection to your clipboard immediately upon _mouseup_. If VS Code could implement this in the integrated terminal, I think it'd be great! 

I will also note I fully understand I could use iTerm2 has an external terminal to make use of this feature today.

data.title: Add setting to disable copy with syntax highlighting
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

There doesn't seem to be a way to turn off the default behavior of copy/pasting with syntax highlighting.  Some users may have a workflow where they want to paste text into an external rich edit text box (like a web form) without the extra formatting but there doesn't seem to be a way to turn this off right now.

/cc @rebornix @RamblingCookieMonster
